description: A game that I've been playing for a (very) long time. After moving to Linux, it was a good surprise to find it here too. Very well implemented, highly advised.
I'm always glad to see this game in the store. Relatively simple game mechanics lead to hours of fun!
summary: Fantastic game, always go back to it with every Ubuntu install!

description: I played this game a lot on PC, will love to be able to play it again on Linux, but I have mousse issues. my mousse moves extremely fast and tend to stay at borders of screen, which makes game impossible to be played. Any suggestions??

I am pleased to see this game on Linux OS, and as a free game. Basics of economy but wrapped in enjoyable way.
Captivating scenarios, that I am finishing one by one. 

Careful: strategy games (at least this one) take hours to complete!
summary: Excellent game. The only game I play ... and for over 20 years now!

description:
This game has been one of my favorites since I was a kind back when it came out. However, something is wrong with the Galleon and Caravel ships in the Linux release, in that they can't be converted to move goods instead of units. If you click on "GOODS", both the GOODS and UNITS buttons appear depressed, and if you click away and then back to the ship, only the UNITS button is depressed. It just feels dumb running Traders everywhere after having researched the Galleon.

Note that you may need to move the music into the appropriate folder yourself, if you can get the .wav files. And definitely do it if you can - the soundtrack for this game was composed originally for the game, and is extensive, complex, and very good.
summary: One of my favorite games, but what's wrong with the ships?
